The rules of Blackjack are simple: Beat the Dealer.

How do you beat the dealer?
		1. By drawing a hand value that is higher than 
		the dealer's hand value.
		2. By the dealer drawing a hand value that goes over 21.
		3. By drawing a hand value of 21 on your first two cards,
		when the dealer does not.

How do you lose to the dealer?
		1. Your hand value exceeds 21.
		2. The dealers hand has a greater value than yours
		at the end of the round.

How do you find a hand's total value?
Blackjack is played with a conventional deck of 52
playing cards and suits don't matter.
		1. 2 through 10 count at face value, i.e. a 2 counts as a two
		a 9 counts as a nine.
		2. Face cards (J, Q, K) count as 10.
		3. Ace can count as a 1 or an 11 depending on which value
		helps the hand the most.

For Blackjack, the player must place a wager on the table
to start a hand.
Once a wager is placed, the dealer will deal two cards
face-up to the player, and one card face-up and one 
card face-down to themself.
The player must decide to either hit or stand.
		Hit: The player takes another card from the deck.
		Stand: The player will take no further cards, keeping
		their score.
If the player or dealer go over 21, they bust!
The winner is decided by who has the highest hand
that is less than or equal to 21. Good luck!
